nodes.bodyText:
@kuFEAR why is this a List instead of an ArrayList?
Because by setting kotlin.collections.List here, both CollectionType.ARRAY and CollectionType.LIST do exactly the same.
hm, I'm not noticed this option for switching collections type, I'll revert this now
but will be better to set List as default collection type for Kotlin, as I see, we don't generate hashCode&equals in response models
this class is created not by generator, why it there? may be it should be added to jackson templates?
